channel.title: Cricket news from ESPN Cricinfo.com
channel.description: Visit Cricinfo.com for up-to-the-minute cricket news, breaking cricket news, live cricket commentary, ball-by-ball commentary, cricket video, cricket audio and features.

item.title: Time out of SL side gave Kusal renewed determination
item.description: Sri Lanka opener Kusal Perera said that getting dropped after a poor run of form late last year provided him motivation to work on refining his game

item.title: Mashrafe says he's stepping aside for next generation
item.description: Outgoing Bangladesh T20 captain Mashrafe Mortaza says that he felt he would be holding back the next generation of fast bowlers if he continued to stay on

item.title: Surrey 'lost the battle' over T20 reforms, admits Alec Stewart
item.description: Alec Stewart, Surrey's director of cricket, admits that the club has "lost the battle" in its attempts to prevent the ECB from embarking on a radical restructuring of T20 cricket

item.title: Mustafa's rare feat seals series for UAE
item.description: UAE captain Rohan Mustafa became the third player in ODI history to score a century and take five wickets in the same innings as PNG crumbled to a 103-run loss in the series decider in Abu Dhabi

item.title: Wife's passport helps de Lange join Glamorgan
item.description: Marchant de Lange, the South Africa fast bowler, has joined Glamorgan on a three-year deal

item.title: Foakes is 'best wicketkeeper in world' - Stewart
item.description: Ben Foakes is the "best wicketkeeper in the world", according to his director of cricket at Surrey, Alec Stewart

item.title: Mashrafe to retire from T20Is after Sri Lanka series
item.description: Mashrafe Mortaza has announced his retirement from T20 internationals during the toss of the first T20I between Sri Lanka and Bangladesh in Colombo

item.title: Kusal Perera 77 aces Sri Lanka chase
item.description: Kusal Perera made a roaring return to Sri Lankan colours, cracking 77 off 53 balls to lead the hosts on a successful hunt of Bangladesh's 155 for 6

item.title: Ishant Sharma picked by Kings XI Punjab
item.description: Kings XI Punjab have added Ishant Sharma to their pace-heavy attack ahead of the tenth season of IPL

item.title: Not easy to emulate 2016 campaign - Williamson
item.description: The New Zealand captain, who has played only eight IPL games over the past two years, said that it was important the new-look Sunrisers team gelled well if they are to have any chance of a title defence

item.title: Depleted challengers take on defending champions in season opener
item.description: Without Virat Kohli, AB de Villiers and KL Rahul, can RCB challenge Sunrisers Hyderabad on their home turf?

item.title: Carlos Brathwaite left out to work on fitness, bowling - Stuart Law
item.description: West Indies head coach Stuart Law has revealed that Carlos Brathwaite was left out of the upcoming ODI series against Pakistan to work on his fitness and bowling

item.title: Shreyas Iyer out with chickenpox
item.description: Delhi Daredevils batsman Shreyas Iyer has been ruled out for at least a week with a bout of chickenpox

item.title: Dane Vilas to play for Dolphins
item.description: Dane Vilas, the former South Africa wicketkeeper, has signed a deal with the Durban-based Dolphins franchise for the 2017-18 season

item.title: Peter Fulton retires from first-class cricket
item.description: Peter Fulton, the former New Zealand batsman, has announced his retirement from first-class cricket

item.title: Top-heavy Lions look to outdo debut success
item.description: Lions have an enviable top order once again, but the bowling attack appears thin, especially considering the absence of the injured Ravindra Jadeja and Dwayne Bravo from the first few matches

item.title: First-XI form concerns for Mumbai Indians
item.description: Though Rohit Sharma, Jos Buttler, Lasith Malinga and Kieron Pollard come into the IPL fit and ready, they don't quite have their usual weight of runs and wickets behind them

item.title: Watson to stand in as Royal Challengers captain
item.description: In the absence of Virat Kohli and with AB de Villiers ruled out of the season opener on April 5, the Australian allrounder Shane Watson has been named interim captain of Royal Challengers Bangalore

item.title: Two crore player contract is peanuts - Shastri
item.description: Ravi Shastri, the former team director, felt that the current compensation structure for India's cricketers left a lot to be desired

item.title: Sri Lanka mull over opening combination
item.description: Captain Upul Tharanga said the choice of their openers in the first T20I will depend on the opposition's plans and involve trying to neutralise the Bangladesh spinners

item.title: Knight Riders replace Russell with de Grandhomme
item.description: Kolkata Knight Riders have taken on New Zealand allrounder Colin de Grandhomme, who has a strike-rate of 171 from 91 innings in all T20 cricket

item.title: Kraigg Brathwaite dropped from ODI squad
item.description: Kraigg Brathwaite has been dropped from West Indies' ODI squad, while Carlos Brathwaite was allowed to go to the IPL

item.title: SL, Bangladesh hunt for bragging rights
item.description: With both the Test and the ODI series ending with a 1-1 scoreline, both teams have one last chance to prove who is better

item.title: Jadeja voted best player of India's home season
item.description: In ESPNCricinfo's poll on India's 13-Test-long home season, the readers agreed with an expert panel on five of seven questions

item.title: Gary Kirsten to coach Hobart Hurricanes
item.description: Gary Kirsten has joined the Hobart Hurricanes as coach of Tasmania's Big Bash League team for the next two seasons

item.title: CA, BCB negotiating format, timing of potential Australia visit
item.description: Australia and Bangladesh are at odds over the timing and format of the tour tentatively scheduled for later this year after the previously planned visit by Steven Smiths' team was scuppered due to security concerns

item.title: Wahab credits bowling plans for T20 success over West Indies
item.description: Wahab Riaz's feels Pakistan's planning and execution on the bowling front has helped them stay dominant over West Indies over the past six months

item.title: Thisara, Jayasuriya earn T20 call-ups
item.description: Kusal Mendis has been omitted from Sri Lanka's T20I squad for the two-match series against Bangladesh; Kusal Perera's inclusion subject to fitness

item.title: Nabi, Dawlat warned for conduct breach
item.description: No formal hearing was needed since both players accepted the sanctions proposed by Graeme La Brooy, the ICC match referee

item.title: Carberry hits ton in comeback after cancer
item.description: Hampshire opener Michael Carberry marked his return to first-class cricket after being diagnosed with cancer by scoring a century against Cardiff MCCU at the Ageas Bowl

item.title: Coach Jayawardene excited by Mumbai's riches
item.description: Mahela Jayawardene hopes to bring his vast T20 experience as a freelance cricketer to the fore in his first full-fledged stint as head coach with Mumbai Indians

item.title: Brilliant Hasan ensures Pakistan take series
item.description: With a spell of 4-2-12-2, the fast bowler kept West Indies down to a below-par total of 124 which his team-mates ran down with six balls to spare

item.title: I was scared by the injury - Rohit
item.description: Rohit Sharma said it was mentally tough to sit out due to injury, but said he didn't want to get frustrated and do "unnecessary or unwanted things" during a lengthy rehabilitation process

item.title: Hameed cleared after scan on hand injury
item.description: Haseeb Hameed, the Lancashire and England opener, has been cleared of serious damage to his hand after suffering an injury on the opening day against Cambridge MCCU

item.title: Vala stars in PNG's series-levelling win
item.description: The win helped consolidate PNG's second position in the ICC WCL table, while UAE, who slumped to their eighth loss in 10 matches, are placed seventh in the eight-team championship

item.title: Mashrafe handed over-rate suspension
item.description: Bangladesh's limited-overs captain Mashrafe Mortaza has been suspended for one ODI for maintaining a slow over-rate during the third one-dayer against Sri Lanka in Colombo

item.title: BCB to send high-performance team to Pakistan, says PCB
item.description: PCB chairman Shaharyar Khan has said that the BCB has agreed to send Bangladesh's high-performance side to Pakistan, possibly in July this year

item.title: All-star Supergiant seek winning formula
item.description: They have a squad studded with the biggest names, but they will need to do much more than they did last year if they are to declare their season a success

item.title: 'I know once I bat five overs, I will get that score' - Lewis
item.description: Following his match-winning 91, Evin Lewis has said he was confident he could make a difference if he batted out a decent amount of time despite his twin failures to begin the T20 series

item.title: Evin Lewis' 91 keeps series alive
item.description: Needing to win the match to stay alive in the series, West Indies demolished Pakistan with the help of Evin Lewis' 91 off 51 balls
